> <OLD - WHEELIE>
>
> At this point, Wheelie frowned.  An Autobot beacon, this did not make sense.
>  Sending a quick pulse along his transponder, sending a quick signal to the
> TELETRAAN computer with the pinged location he was picking up the trnsponder
> signal from.
>
> This did not seem like RODIMUS, Rodimus would be running on a Maximal
> frequency, not an Autobot one.  And if someone was attempting to use an
> AUTOBOT signal as lure for a trap, would it not be easier to use a Maximal
> one instead, given the number who had according to what LEO PRIME had said
> gone missing?
>
> And so, WHEELIE, after pinging his quick burst transmission over to the
> ARK's computer banks, began to quietly go towards the transponder signal,
> his energon slingshot out now in his hands and charged.

<NEW>

It took only a moment for WHEELIE to realize (. . . or remember)  that
he no longer had communication to the outside world. His attempt to
ping Teletran-one was met with utter silence.

However even the signal he was recieving was strange. It was not a
communication in the conventional sense. It was a resonance wave that
was traveling along the backround energy that was in this strange
jungle. Like a small leaf floating along a larger river, the signal
went out riding on the wave of energy that seemed to permeate this
section of jungle. It was detectable by WHEELIE's communication gear
but it was not being transmitted along the typical lines.

One thing WHEELIE may remember is that RODIMUS is still Autobot having
never become a Maximal. And it was not that this signal was being
transmitted on an Autobot frequency, because anyone Maximal or Autobot
would have recieved it had they been with WHEELIE, but it was
transmitting an Autobot distress signal.

However that does lead to the question as to how RODIMUS would be
transmitting it, if it was RODIMUS at all? RODIMUS was smart, but he
never showed an apptitude for advanced communication skills,
especailly along the lines as this - tapping into a background energy
resonance and transmitting a signal across it - it did seem to be
beyond his skill set.

(TAG)

Preston
